On Thu, Feb 11, 2010 at 4:28 PM, willmcqueen <willmcqueen@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Has anyone out there tried moving all of your JUnit test cases into a separate Eclipse project, rather than keeping them within your main project?

Yep, very happily, and many times.  The only times I don't:

1) Very early in an experimental greenfield project that I might throw
away (actually, then, my movement is usually to move the system code
to another project, keeping the first project as the test project)
2) When existing project structure before I joined makes it difficult.

   David Saff
